title: Recently switched to AT&T Uverse, and now I can't connect to the login queue
body: I have been playing league of legends without issues for several years while using Comcast internet. I recently moved into a new house that has AT&T Uverse through DirecTV. Now suddenly I cannot login. I get the "Unable to connect to the login queue, check the server, follow the guide" message. The server status is fine and my friends have been playing so I know it is Uverse that is causing the issues. I have run the Hextech repair tool, opened the appropriate ports, made sure I have a firewall exception, and re-installed League of Legends. Nothing seems to work. Any help would be appreciated!

replies.body: I haven't been hearing any issues with AT&T UVerse lately, but you might actually be onto something. Sometimes ISP's can route your signal in a really weird way that can prevent you from accessing specific servers, in this case Riot's servers. Let's run through your [**network settings**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) really quickly again to make sure everything is set up correctly there, but let me know if you're still having this problem and I can dig a little more!
